description: Alterations including formation of balcony with 1.7m high obscure glazed screening and access door.
subdivision_of_building: Rear 2nd floor of flat/ground floor of flat no.74.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed formation of balcony, due to its siting, design and location, would be a prominent, visually intrusive and discordant feature that would fail to relate appropriately to the host building and local spatial character. The development would therefore be contrary to policies LP1 and LP5 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023) and the Wandsworth Housing SPD (2016).

Reason : 2 - By reason if its scale, siting and design, the proposed development would be an unneighbourly form of development that would result in a sense of overbearing and loss of outlook to the harm to the amenities of neighbouring occupiers. Furthermore, the application has failed to demostrate that the balcony would not result in a harmful loss of daylight and sunlight to the flat directly below. The development would therefore be contrary to policy LP2 of the of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023) and Housing SPD (2016).

Reason : 3 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service. However, we have been unable to seek solutions to problems as the proposal is clearly contrary to our statutory policies and negotiation could not overcome the reasons for refusal.
